abstract: Rather than being greeted by an avalanche of shopping possibilities, Internet shoppers can subscribe to shopping sites that suggest items with the user’s style in mind.
snippet: Rather than being greeted by an avalanche of shopping possibilities, Internet shoppers can subscribe to shopping sites that suggest items with the user’s style in mind.
lead_paragraph: When Emily McNish shopped for jewelry online, she was overwhelmed by the options while searching for “gold necklace” on e-commerce sites or Google. Then she found a Web site called JewelMint that she lets shop for her.

headline.main: Sites That Send Shoppers What They Might Like
headline.print_headline: Sites That Send Shoppers What They Might Like

abstract: According to a new report, in the first quarter of 2011, Facebook overtook Google as the leading social log-in site.
snippet: According to a new report, in the first quarter of 2011, Facebook overtook Google as the leading social log-in site.
lead_paragraph: If you’re reading this article online, glance to the right for the opportunity to share or recommend it. Doing so via a third-party Web site is an example of social log-in services — and Facebook has just overtaken Google as the leading social log-in site.

headline.main: One Log-In Catches on for Many Sites
headline.print_headline: One Log-In Catches On for Many Sites
